intro: Urticastrum photiniphylla, commonly known as the photinia-leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which can cause mild irritation upon contact. Urticastrum photiniphylla is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
